block.p: BEDFORD PARK Back to the Garden, Camera in Hand
''Images of the Garden: Photographers Sundays'' is a series of workshops at the New York Botanical Garden in the Bronx that offer tips on capturing garden images.

Today at 11 a.m., Joseph De Sciose will use his own before-and-after shots in a lecture and a field trip to point out how to correct common errors in garden photography. From 1 to 4 p.m., Nan Melville will display and discuss her new garden portraits in the Shop in the Garden, with a brief field trip at 2:30 p.m. Participants are asked to be prepared for any weather, because the event goes on rain or shine.

LOWER MANHATTAN Puppet Theater From Vietnam

Multicolored swans, jumping fish, plumed peacocks, fairies (shown below) and pirouetting dragons that breathe real fire and spout water bring folk stories from Vietnam to life at the Saigon Water Puppet Theater at the Hudson River Festival.
A colorful temple serves as a backdrop to the hand-crafted puppets as they dance and dart across the bright pool of water, moving to traditional Vietnamese music.

The puppets are manipulated to tell both mythological tales and tales of daily life from the farming villages of Vietnam by a crew of 15 puppeteers. They hide behind a wooden screen while wading waist deep in the 7,500-gallon pool to manipulate the puppets with underwater rods and wires.
Saigon Water Puppet Theater at the Hudson River Festival; today, 3 p.m.; World Financial Center Plaza, Liberty Street and Hudson River; free; (212) 528-2733.
QUEENS A Singer Who Makes Libraries Lively

Dispelling the common notion that libraries are places for quiet time, Joe McDermott (pictured at right), whose performances are anything but quiet, will sing and play guitar for families throughout the week at eight branches of the Queens Borough Library.

Mr. McDermott won a 1998 Parents' Choice Award for his most recent recording, titled ''I Am Baby.'' The former Montessori teacher, who lives in Austin, Tex., has worked with Stan and Jan Berenstain, the creators of the Berenstain Bears, and has written music for software and video games, including ''Freddie Fish.''
Mr. McDermott is currently collaborating on a video and compact disc project called ''All Strapped In,'' which involves movements young children can do while in their car seats.
Joe McDermott; tomorrow through Thursday at various times and locations of the Queens Borough Library; all events free; full schedule at (718) 990-0778.
